content.description: Starting on the holds of Parka Pushing, traverse left staying at about chest level. End on the start of Crimps in a Coat.
content.location: Start on Parka Pushing, and end on Crimps in a Coat.

content.description: Climb the face, avoiding the arete.

climbs.name: Pinches in a Poncho
climbs.fa: Ian Bulovic, also set by Gabe Brown and Aria Harris

content.description: Purple = hand options, and red = foot options. Start at the low pinches moving your left hand up, then move your right hand out. Throw your right hand up to thiccums pinch. Your left hand goes to the arete. Heel hook your right foot, get a good pinch, then move your right hand to the top. Place your feet wherever during the middle part.
content.location: See the picture and the description.

content.description: Climb the lower angle portion of the east face on nice pinches and positive holds
Sit start on or below the obvious rail/ledge.  Angle up the ledge to access the large jugs in the middle of the face. From there, it's up and over.
content.location: This is on the south-facing, overhung face.

content.description: Sit start at the bottom of the arete, and climb straight up on the positive crimps.

This route starts to the left of Jugs in a Jacket and follows an almost direct topout to a slopey face.

 Sit start left and below the shelf at the start of Jugs... with your hands matched on a sloper with a crimpy crease. Find a couple of well-positioned foot chips, and move up towards and intermediate crimp/pinch, or make a big move to the overhead slopey shelf with a good crack in it. Reposition your feet on the shelf, and move left using a sharp, black crimp and a small, horny pinch. Top out on a sloping face using some small crimps or pockets.
content.protection: A pad or two, and a spotter helps.
content.location: It is on the South face of Whipple Boulder and is located left of Jugs in a Jacket.

content.description: Start on the beginning of Parka Pushing, then move up and left to finish between Gran Capote and Poncho Pulling.
content.protection: One or two pads and a spotter.
content.location: Start on Parka Pushing, and top out to the left of Poncho Pulling.

content.description: Sit start on crimps below and towards the right side of the ledge of Jugs in a Jacket, pull a few hard moves on crimps, and finish as for Gran Capote. The ledge is considered off route.
content.location: Start on the obvious crimps below Jugs in a Jacket, and move up on small rails and around the arete.

content.description: Blank in a Tank is a fun problem if you're looking for more of a challenge than the surrounding routes. Sit start on big crimps/edges under the jugs ledge (off!) with a toe/heel around the corner, then move left on the steep low face, using sometimes slopey edges to get to the start of Crimps.... Finish up Crimps in a Coat. The crux comes midway moving off a slippery right hand with a minuscule thumb catch.
content.location: Start under the arete, and move left.

content.description: This fine boulder host several easy problems, plenty of fun holds, and good landings.
